baseline_groups.claim_summary: Believing one does not lose from a carbon tax with dividend increases tax acceptance by ~36 percentage points.
baseline_groups.notes: Cross-sectional OLS with demographic, income, political, and urbanicity controls. Coefficient 0.363 (p<0.001). Survey-weighted. N~3,000 French respondents.

baseline_groups.claim_summary: Believing the carbon tax is environmentally effective increases tax approval by ~40 percentage points.
baseline_groups.notes: Environmental effectiveness channel. Coefficient 0.405 (p<0.001). Separate baseline group because it tests a distinct channel (environmental beliefs vs. self-interest beliefs).

global_notes: Survey experiment during Yellow Vests movement in France. Two channels tested: self-interest beliefs (G1) and environmental effectiveness beliefs (G2). IV specifications using randomized information treatments as instruments. 97.4% of all specs positive, 93.5% significant at 5%.
